questions.question_text: What is the benefit of using the Cisco Nexus Dashboard single sign-on feature?

choices.D: It allows the user to switch seamlessly between the hosted services.
choices.C: It manages operations of the infrastructure using a single pane of glass.
choices.B: It adds a security layer based on multifactor authentication.
choices.A: It provides notifications about end of sale for the deployed switches.

discussion.content: the question is about SSO, the answer is D

C is correct:
"C. It manages operations of the infrastructure using a single pane of glass."

It allows the user to switch between hosted services - this is wrong as we are not switching between the hosted services but the network devices.

comments.content:
It is D, indeed:

Single Sign-On (SSO): SSO powers the frictionless interaction between one or multiple Cisco Nexus Dashboard clusters and their HOSTED services.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D correct. Previous question from list states that

Selected Answer: D
‚óè Dynamic pool including static ranges: You can also define a dynamic pool that includes both a dynamic VLAN range and a static range. When associating such a pool to an EPG (using a VMM domain), this gives you the option to either let Cisco APIC pick a VLAN from the pool or to enter manually a VLAN for this EPG (from the static range). When entering a VLAN manually for an EPG associated with a VMM domain, Cisco APIC programs the VLAN that you entered on the virtualized host port group.

questions.question_text:
An engineer is implementing a Cisco ACI fabric and must use static VLAN range as part of a VMM deployment. The static VLAN must be incorporated into the dynamic VLAN pool. The existing VLAN pool is set for dynamic allocation.

Which action accomplishes this goal?

choices.B: Change the existing VLAN pool to static allocation mode.
choices.A: Create a static reservation within the dynamic VLAN pool.
choices.C: Add the VLAN to the pool configured with Inherit Allocation Mode from parent.
choices.D: Add a static VLAN allocation range to the VLAN pool.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
c is the correct answer

questions.question_text: What is the impact of a nondisruptive upgrade on fabric and modular switches?

choices.C: If a zone server merge is in progress, the upgrade continues without interruption.
choices.D: When the installation is complete, the system BIOS must be updated.
choices.B: During the upgrade, new devices cannot log in to the fabric.
choices.A: The upgrade disrupts the control plane for more than 120 seconds.
The SW9621-2 router becomes a new active master.
choices.B: The SW9621-1 router becomes a new active master after 3 seconds.
choices.D: The SW9621-2 router becomes an active master after 3 seconds.
choices.C: The SW9621-1 router remains an active master.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Router will actually wait for Master Down interval before becoming master so more like 9 seconds (3x advertisement timer)

Selected Answer: D
Advertisement will be sent 3 seconds after it comes online, only at that point will it discover it has a better priority and then preempt

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
I guess it should be D as the preemption is enabled by default, and advertisment interval is set to 3 seconds
To the configuration I hope nothing...
A. preemption is enabled on Sw1, so we can assume that is also enabled on SW-2
Since it was not stated in the question, we should assume that SW2 does not have preemption enabled because it is not enabled by default. so C, is a posible answer.

Selected Answer: A
I would choose A. https://www.cisco.com/assets/sol/sb/Switches_Emulators_v2_3_5_xx/help/350_550/index.html#page/tesla_350_550_olh/ts_vrrp_18_09.html
2nd switch has 160 priority and it will be active after it is powered up. Preemtion is enabled. Advertisement interval is meant of detection failed node and there are important metric - timeout interval for detecting down. its three times of advertisement. preemption delay is related to preemption.
